intro: Lilium talanense, commonly known as the Talanense lily, is a species of bulbous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces large, trumpet-shaped blooms in shades of white, pink, or red, which appear in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, forming a basal rosette, and it thrives in well-drained, fertile soils. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
